discussion_comments.comment_body:
Mkdoc does not support absolute links by default and we cannot detect broken links if absolute links are used
https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs/issues/192#issuecomment-75322787
Current use of absolute links has caused many broken links so far.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
I think this will break? I tried this link: https://dspy.ai/tutorials/observability/index.md#tracing, and it gives 404, but https://dspy.ai/tutorials/observability/#tracing works. 

I remember it's an mkdocs design pattern to not include `index.md` in the hyperlink.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -8,15 +8,15 @@
 
     DSPy is deployed in production by many enterprises and startups. Explore real-world case studies.
 
-    [:octicons-arrow-right-24: Use Cases](../community/use-cases)
+    [:octicons-arrow-right-24: Use Cases](../community/use-cases.md)
 
 - :material-magnify-expand:{ .lg .middle } __Monitoring & Observability__
 
     ---
 
     Monitor your DSPy programs using **MLflow Tracing**, based on OpenTelemetry.
 
-    [:octicons-arrow-right-24: Set Up Observability](../tutorials/observability/#tracing)
+    [:octicons-arrow-right-24: Set Up Observability](../tutorials/observability/index.md#tracing)
discussion_comments.comment_body: It actually works without any problem. Mkdoc creates a link for `tutorials/observability/#tracing` rather than `tutorials/observability/index.md#tracing` in this case. Without `index.md` Mkdoc does not understand the relative link. >INFO - Doc file 'production/index.md' contains an unrecognized relative link '../tutorials/observability/#tracing', it was left as is. Did you mean '../tutorials/observability/index.md#tracing'?
